response.answer_text: We really don’t know. The most famous ones are the Nazca Lines in Peru, but the oldest one, as far as we know, is “The Moose”, which lies close to Lake Zyuratkul in the southern Ural Mountains of Russia. It is made from stone and predates the Nazca Lines by thousands of years. It surely is possibe that somewhere on Earth older geoglyphs are still hidden under sand, forests, or water.
